===Etymology===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=えんまく}} compound term {{m|zh|煙幕|tr=ʔen mak|lit=smoke + curtain, screen}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} ''yānmù'', {{etyl|yue|-}} ''jin<sup>1</sup> mok<sup>6</sup>''.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|えんまく|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|えんまく}}

# a [[smokescreen]]

====Usage notes====
“To lay or place a smokescreen” is expressed in Japanese using the verb {{m|ja|張る|tr=haru||to stretch taut}}, probably in reference to the {{m|en|curtain}} meaning expressed by the {{m|ja|幕|tr=maku}} character.
: {{ja-usex|攻撃を困難にするために'''煙幕'''を張る|こうげき を こんなん に する ため に '''えんまく''' を はる|place a '''smokescreen''' to make it difficult to attack [us]}}

Also used in a figurative sense.
: {{ja-usex|好きな人について'''煙幕'''を張る|すき な ひと に ついて '''えんまく''' を はる|put up a '''smokescreen''' about the person [he / she] likes}}
